abstract: Diverse congregation at Redemption Church in Greenville, SC, has unspoken political divisions  among members, subject to be avoided at all costs as South Carolina presidential primary nears; black members tend to vote Democratic, while white members vote Republican; diversity is seen as point of pride in church, but discussion of upcoming election is essentially off limits.
lead_paragraph: Members of Redemption, based in Greenville, S.C., are proud of their ethnic diversity. But discussion of the state’s presidential primaries? “A taboo,” one woman there said.

headline.main: South Carolina Church Bridges Racial Gap, but Not Political Divide
headline.print_headline: At Church Where Races Unite, Politics Divides

snippet: Members of Redemption, based in Greenville, S.C., are proud of their ethnic diversity. But discussion of the state’s presidential primaries? “A taboo,” one woman there said.
